DataElement.preferredName: Imaging Technique Observation Performed Study Activity Negation Occurrence Reason ISO21090.DSET.SC.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of obtaining pictures of the interior or exterior of the body usually for diagnostic reasons. EXAMPLE(S): X-ray, MRI The text and/or code that describes the rationale behind why an activity is not done.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Imaging Technique Observation Performed Study Activity Negation Occurrence Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Imaging Technique Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
